page.title: 07SPECIAL EDUCATION-AUCHINLECK
page.content: Easton Place School,Auchinleck, provides special education for profoundly handicapped children between the ages of 2 - 16. The school has a staff of 4 and 10 pupils. After leaving Easton Place the children have the option of attending the Adult Training Centre in Auchinleck. Here they are taught basic life skills such as making a cup of tea, also handcrafts like basket making.There are 5 instructors and up to 54 places available.This centre has no upper age limit. Within the village a council house is kept as a 'half-way house' for a small group of handicapped people, that is,a house where they can learn to become independent within the community but still remain under the watchful eye of the social services.
